txt: (to Bonnie) So ah, your first sexual experience was with a woman?!

All right, I was 15, it was my best friend, Ruth, and we got drunk on
that hard cider, and then suddenly, I don’t know, we were, we were making out.
Tell it again. (pause, we see Rachel is not amused.) Seriously.

(to Monica) I mean is that woman capable of talking about anything else
but sex?
Yeah, sure. Well y'know, earlier she was talking about geography.
Joey, she was listing the countries she’s done it in.
Well, I think we all learned something.

(entering, hurridly) Hey, you guys! Look what I found! Look at this!
(She hands Chandler a picture) That’s my Mom’s writing! Look.

(reading the back of the picture) Me and Frank and Phoebe, Graduation
1965.
Y'know what that means?
That you’re actually 50?
No-no, that’s not, that’s not
Oh!
That is so cool.

I know! So this woman probably could like have all kinds of stories
about my parents, and she might even know like where my Dad is. So I looked her up, and
she lives out by the beach. So maybe this weekend we could go to the beach?
Yeah! Yeah, we can!
(to Ross) Shoot! I can’t go, I have to work!
That’s too bad.
(sarcastic) Ohh, big, fat bummerrr.
So great! Okay! Tomorrow we’re gonna drive out to Montauk.
Hey, Bonnie had sex there!

(watching a happy couple walk by, arm in arm) Would you look at them. Am
I ever gonna find a boyfriend again? I gonna die an old maid.
You’re not gonna die an old maid, maybe an old spinster cook.
(sarcastic) Thanks!
Hey now besides, if worst comes to worst, I’ll be your boyfriend.
Yeah right.
Why is that so funny?
You made a joke right? So I laughed.
Ha-ha-ha. A little to hard. What am I not ah, boyfriend material?
Well, no. You’re Chandler. Y'know, Chandler! (hits him on the arm)

Okay, so we’ve established my name, and hit me. But theoretically
y'know, I mean say we weren’t friends, say it’s a blind date. I show up at your
door, and I’m like (in a fake voice) “Hey, nice to meet, ya. Hey, oh-hey.”
Well I’d probably be scared of a guy using a fake voice.
(walking up carrying a brown paper bag) Hey!
Oh, hey! Oh good, you brought food!
No, it’s just my luggage.
Hey!!
Woo-hoo! All right! Yeah!

Oh, I am having the best karma this week. First, I find this woman who
knew my parents, and then my client with the fuzzy back gives me his beach house.
Yeah? What about ah, that bike messenger you hit?
Oh, I wasn’t talking about his karma.
(approaching) Hey!
Hey!
Hey-hey, check out the hat!
giant

What a minute, I know that hat! I was taken aboard that hat! They did
experiments on me! I can’t have children!!
Seriously, where did you get the hat?
Ross gave it to me.
Yeah, I think she looks good.
Ohh, thank you.
Buy it for ya, or win it for ya?

Well excuse me, my fashion-impaired friends, I am here to tell you that
hats are back.
And this time, they’ve ganged up to form one giant, super hat.
Go, go, go!
Oh yeah, now everybody wants to be under this hat!
Oy!!

What’s with all this sand? (picking a handful of sand off of the
floor, which is covered in sand)
Oh, yeah, Bob said there might be flood damage.
Yeah, either that, or he has a really big cat.

Well, yes, it’s kind’ve an unusual house. It has umm, three
beautiful bedrooms and ah, no baths. But y'know, the ocean is right there.
(at the door) Knock, knock, knock.

(on phone) Ah, oh, hang on a second. (to Phoebe) Come in, come in.
(on phone) All right, so think about it, and call me back. (hangs up)
(entering) Are you ah, Phoebe Abott?
Ahh, yes.
Hi Phoebe Abott, I’m your best friends daughter!
You’re Erwin’s daughter?!

No, I-I mean your-your old best friend, here. (hands her the picture)
Lily, from high school. Remember?
Oh gosh, Lily, yes. Of course I remember Lily. I... Then you must be?

(points to herself) Phoebe. (points to her) Phoebe. Phoebe, yeah. She
named me after you I guess.
Uh-huh. Wow! Well, look! There’s Frank. (points to the picture.)

Yes!! Yes! Yes! Yes!! That’s my Dad, that’s Frank! Yeah!
I’m sorry I’m getting all flingy.

Take it easy--if you want, there’s cookies on the counter, or,
or--sangria! (jumps up) I can make sangria!
No-no, sorry. Cookies are good, thanks.
Oh.

(goes and gets some cookies) Well, so, umm, anyway umm, I’ve been,
I’ve been looking for my Father, and umm, have you heard from him, or seen him?

Oh no, I-I’m sorry, I guess we lost track of everybody after
high school.

(disappointed) Oh, okay. Well, so tell me everything about my parents.
Everything.

Ohh, well. Y'know we were always together, in fact the had a nickname
for the three of us.
Oh, what? What was it?

The three losers. Oh, poor Lily. (Phoebe notices a picture on the
fridge, takes it, and puts it in her pocket.) Ohh, y'know I-I heard about what happened,
that must have been just terrible for you, losing your mother that way.
(happily) Yeah, no, it was great.
(getting an idea) Hey, y'know what a really good rainy day game is?
What?!
I mean naked game. Strip poker, we should totally play strip poker.
No, no!
What are you crazy?!
Come on! When you go away, you-you have to play, it’s like a law!
(to Monica) Allll done!
Aww, thank you.

Okay, who’s next?! (She looks around the room, and stops when she
comes to Ross.)
No-o-o! (Rachel gives him a “Please?” look.) No way!
Come on, please?! I’m boredddd! You let me do it once before.

Yeah well, if ah, if that’s the rule this weekend... (She gets up)
No!
Yes! (she starts creeping up on him)
Get away!
Just once!
Stay away!
Take it like a man, Ross!

(he gets up and starts to run away from her) No! (in his escape attempt he
crushes Chandler’s sand castle) No!
Oh, come on!
Big bullies!!
Ow! Ow! Oh, no-no-no!
(entering) Oh, hey!
Hey!
Hey!
Oh, so, how are we doing?
Bored and bored!
Hey, you know what naked card game is never boring?
Noo!!
(to Phoebe) So what’s Phoebe like?
I’m kind, caring, and sweet. What’s Monica like?
Ah no, the other Phoebe, the one you went to go see.
Ohh, I think she knows where my Dad is.
What?
Really?!
Oh well, where is he?!

She was acting, she was pretending like she hasn’t heard from him
on years, but I found this picture on her fridge, and look (shows Monica)! Isn’t this
what he would look like now?
(gasps) Totally familiar. (Phoebe shows the rest of them.)
Oh, yeah.
Yeah!
Well, why would she lie to you?

I don’t know, but we’re having dinner tomorrow night, so I
figured, she’s gonna tell me then. Y'know maybe she just wanted to give him time to,
buy me presents, I don’t know! So, you’re all bored?
Ohh!!
Yes!

All right, I’m gonna close my eyes and point to someone, and you,
whoever I point has to come up with something fun for us to do, and we
Okay, all right.
Okay.
Fan out! Fan out!

Okay. (Starts to spin) Ooh, y'know we could just do this. (She stops at
Chandler)
Okay, umm, we all have to play strip poker.
(jumping in triumph) OH YES!!!!!
Strip Happy Days Game?

Yeah, well, I couldn’t find any cards, so it was either this or Strip
Bag Of Old Knitting Stuff.

Okay, (reading the card) Fonzy gives you two thumbs up, collect two cool
points. Yeah.

Monica, if you get five cool points, you get to make somebody take off
one item of clothing. It hasn’t happened yet, but we’re all very excited.

Okay, come on! (blows on the dice) Daddy needs a new pair of
electromagnetic microscopes for the Prehistoric Forensics Department! (They all look at
him, and he shuts up and rolls the dice.) (he moves his piece) Okay. (reading a card) Take
Pinky Tuscadero up to Inspiration Point, collect three cool points!! Yeah! Which gives me
five, and let’s see who is gonna lose their clothes. Ummmm, I think I pick our strip
poker sponsor Mr. Joey Tribianni.
All right, relax. It’s just a shoe.
Wooooo!!!!

(reading a card) Okay, your band is playing at Arnold’s, collect
three cool points. Which means, I have five, and that means I get Joey’s boxers!
Fine. Gang up on me! I got you all right where I want you.
Come on, take ‘em off!!

Actually, y'know it’s kinda cold, so how about I keep my boxers on,
and give you all a peek at the good stuff?

(getting up) All right, I’m gonna make more margaritas! (She pours
the rest of the pitcher into Ross’s glass.)
Whoa, hey! What are doing? Trying to get me drunk?
I’m just making margaritas.
Okay.

I think I’ll help her out. (She gets up to go over and help Rachel,
and reveals she has no pants.) (to Rachel) What is going on here?
What?!
You painting his toenails?
Oh, come on!
Chasing him all around the room?
Monica, please?
He’s totally flirting with you too.

(pause) He is, isn’t he? I don’t know, I don’t know, I
mean maybe it’s just being here at the beach together or, I don’t know. But
it’s like something... (she’s interrupted by the sound of Bonnie entering)
Hey!
Hey! (Rachel is shocked) Hi Bonnie!
Hi! My boss let me off early, so I took the train.
Oh.
What are you guys doing?!
We’re playing Strip Happy Days Game!
Cool! I’ll catch up! (She takes off her sweater.)
So, you still don’t think I’m boyfriend material?
Huh?
I saw you checking me out during the game last night.
You didn’t even take off your pants.
Yeah, well, lucky for you.
What?
I don’t know.
(entering) Well! Is everybody else having just the
Shhh! Shhhh! Joey’s asleep.
After he passed out, we put the sand around him to keep him warm.

Well I assume the ah, happy couple isn’t up yet. Did you guys hear
them last night?

Oh, yeah, I don’t know what they were doing, but at one point sea
turtles actually came up to the house.
Good morning.
Hey.
Hey! How did everybody sleep?
Oh, great.
Like a log.
Us too.
I’m going for a walk.
(to Joey) Good morning. Nice breasts by the way.
Hey, what happened to you?
Oh, ah nothin’. I just felt like hangin’ out here and reading.

Oh, the water was sooo great! We jumped off this pier and my suit came
off.
Ohhhh, sorry I missed that.
Yeah, Joey and Chandler sure are funny.
Ohh-ha-ha!

I think I brought back half of the beach in my hair. It was so much
easier when I used to shave my head.
Y'know, I gotta tell ya, I just
Really?!
Ohh!
Because I think about shaving it all off again sometime.
Really?!
Yeah!
I mean you definitely should do that.
Y'know what, I should do it.
Yeah!
Yeah, thank you Rachel, you are soo cool.
Awww, stop. Come on. Now go shave that head!
All right.
What’s the matter, Pheebs?
She cancelled! My namesake cancelled on me!
What?!

Yeah, she clamed she had to go out of town suddenly. She’s avoiding
me, she doesn’t want to tell me where my Father is. She knows, and she won’t
tell me.
Aww Pheebs, that sucks!

Yeah, well, don’t “Aww Pheebs, that sucks!” me yet. (she
starts to leave)
Where ya going?

Well, she’s out of town so, there’s gotta be something in her
house that tells me where my Father is.
Uh, Pheebs, some people call that breaking and entering.
Well, are any of those people here?!
Oh, no!! No, no!

Okay, look I-I-I do something nice, okay? I’ll-I’ll fill her
ice trays.
Hey, everybody!
Wow!! (they all recoil in shock and horror)

Wh-haa-haa! Look what ‘cha did! (Rachel has her hand over her mouth
to keep from laughing.)
You wanna touch it?
Nooo, but it, but it’s great.
Come on, touch it!
Okay. (He gently touches it.) You can feel all the bones in your skull.
Hi.
Hi!

I was having a little chat with ah, Bonnie, and ah, guess what, she-she
happened to bring up y'know, who was behind the um, whole head shaving idea, and now, who
was it? Oh, that’s right, that’s right, it was you!
That was her idea,
She said you gave her the razor!
(joining them) Hey guys.
Hey!
So, anyone up for a midnight dip in the ocean?
Ahh, no, I’m good.
Okay, I’ll see you in a bit.
Okay, have fun! Wooo!!
Come on see, she doesn’t look that bad.

You can see the moonlight bouncing off her head! What the hell were you
thinking?!!
I don’t know.
You don’t know?! Rach, you balded my girlfriend!

All right! Ross, do you think it’s easy for me to see you with
somebody else?
Y'know, hey! You’re the one who ended it, remember?
Yeah, because I was
You still love me?
Noo.
You still love me.
Oh, y-yeah, so, you-you love me!

Noo, nnnnn. What does this mean? What do you, I mean do you wanna, get
back together?

Noo! Maybe! I, I don’t know. Ross, I still can’t forgive you
for what you did, I can’t, I just, but sometimes when I’m with you I just, I
feel so...
What?!
I just, I feel, I-I just...
What?
I feel...

(to Joey) Noo!! I don’t care! I’m not, I’m not gonna
playing one-on-one strip poker with you for practice!
But I made cards!!
Well! Good night. (to Ross) I’m going upstairs.
G’night.
(to Ross) Wanna play strip poker for practice?

Ow! My ass. Okay. Okay. (She manages to climb completely inside and the
window slams shut.) Oh, shhh!

No! No!! It’s me! It’s me! I-I didn’t want to make any
noise!
Then don't break in!!
I’m sorry.
What are you doing here?!
I-I, came to fill your ice cube trays.
What?!

Umm, okay, okay, look. I took this picture from your fridge. Okay,
because I know that this is my Father. Yeah, this is Frank Buffay and you are standing
right there next to him. Now, look I deserve to know where I came from. All right? So if
you can help me find my Father then you should! Otherwise, you’re just mean! (pause)
So, just tell me the truth!
All right, the man in the picture is Chuck Magioni.
My Father is Chuck Magioni?

No, no, that’s just Chuck Magioni, I-I sold him a house last
year! And I’m very sorry, but I don’t know where your Father is, and that’s
the truth.
Oh.

But umm, you’re right. I think that a person should know where
they come from. Wh-which is why I ah, (pause) ahh, (pause) okay. I’m your mother.
Heh?

Y'know I wanted to tell you yesterday, but I just, I kinda felt all
floopy, and...
I’m telling ya, you guys are totally getting back together!

That’s not true! Her, she doesn’t even know what she wants!
Rachel’s still mad about the whole thing.

Okay, then you gotta back away, all right? You don’t need that
kind’ve hurt. Take it from a guy who’s never had a long term relationship......
I know, but ahhhhhh!! I really wanna go up there and finish that kiss!
(coming back from her swim) Hey!
Ahhhh! (Steps away from her.)
You guys, the water’s great. You should really go in.
Oh, ahh, no thanks, I just had an M&M.
Okay, well g’night.
Good night.
(kisses Ross) Don’t be too long.
Okey-dokey!
There is not

Hey, it’ll grow back, right? And she-she’s really fun, and
she’s cool, and-and I’m finally moving on. Y'know? I mean getting over Rachel
was so (makes an incoherent nasal sound), y'know? Y'know, and I’m finally feeling
sane again. And now if I go up there, and-and I kiss her, and, Gooood I wanna kiss her,
and-and-and it doesn’t work out, right? Do I really wanna put myself through that
again?

So let me get this straight. If you go with Bonnie tonight, you’re
doing the smart, healthy thing and moving on.
Yeah.
Right, and you go with Rachel, Bonnie’s free tonight?
(entering the bedroom) Hi. (closes the door)
(in a fake voice) Hi there.
That’s that weird voice again.

Okay! Okay! Let me try it again, you’re gonna wanna date this
next guy, I swear!

Hi! I’m Dorf! You’re date for the evening. (Monica walks
away in disgust) Oh come on! Dorf on dating, that’s good stuff!!
